intro: Iresine hartmanii var. gentryi, commonly known as the red-veined strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage with deep red veins contrasting against bright green leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in spikes at the ends of its stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden settings. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
